trans-unit.target: Hi you. I'm Jim and on this page you will get some information about me first hand. So don't waste your time with job portals or web search engines if you want to know me better. Stay here and get information about my qualifications, what I have done, what I expect and much more.

Great! You're still here. If you want to get in touch, write me an email to the email address listed in the sidebar on the right side. I check my mails mostly on a daily basis. But before you send me job offerings or other things, continue reading to understand a little better who I am.

I have started programming around 2008. After learning HTML (which is not a programming language), I quickly started learning PHP which was my first real programming language. Ever since this time I continued programming mostly on basis of the WoltLab Community Framework which resulted in my first fully featured web application named 'Ultimate CMS' which was released on March 15, 2014.

You can see that software development is my passion and even nowadays I spend most of my time developing software. This hobby gives me interesting challenges to solve and opportunities to exchange knowledge with others to improve the quality of my work even further. As a result of that I learned to love free and open source software, which encourages collaborating to reach a common goal. Therefore I have released all my software so far under a Free Software license like LGPL. Especially the recent projects are hosted on GitHub.

Web development becomes more and more important and I am happy to say that I have experience in this field for about 5 years now. During this time I had contact to almost all aspects of modern web applications: frontend and backend (PHP), templates (HTML, Twig, Smarty), client-side scripting (JavaScript including jQuery), persistence (MySQL, filesystems) and design (CSS).

I love developing modular software that allows me to concentrate on the parts I master, while leaving other parts to those that are better in it. As an example I am no talented at all in design, so I like software that allows me to concentrate on the business logic and structure and let others do the styles. And with that I don't mean let others hardcode it but rather let the style be easy exchangable.

But I have interests in other areas as well. I am awaiting Star Citizen which will be the BestDamnSpaceSimEver (BDSSE), made by the space legend Chris Roberts.

Finally I have one proposal for every potential employer: Hire me to work on my own projects. That way I will be able to concentrate more on these projects, they get finished sooner (up to a certain level) and many people will profit from it. Above that I will recommend you as a good employer. In these times this is an endorsement that is not earned easy.
